title: Support arrays for chef-zero data_bags_path
body:
GH-6561 changed the documentation / template to support arrays in `data_bags_path` for chef-zero and chef-solo, but missed a last step to fully support them in chef-zero.
I created the pull request #9669 to fix this issue.

### Vagrant version

Vagrant 2.0.3, also happens on master (Vagrant 2.0.4.dev).

### Host operating system
Debian 9.

### Guest operating system
Debian 9.

### Vagrantfile

Inspired by https://www.vagrantup.com/docs/provisioning/chef_zero.html#usage, be sure to run `mkdir cookbooks1 cookbooks2 data_bags1 data_bags2 nodes1 nodes2 roles1 roles2` before.
```ruby
Vagrant.configure("2") do |config|
  config.vm.box = "bento/debian-9"
  config.vm.provision :chef_zero do |chef|
    chef.version = "12"

    chef.cookbooks_path = ["cookbooks1", "cookbooks2"]
    chef.data_bags_path = ["data_bags1", "data_bags2"]
    chef.nodes_path = ["nodes1", "nodes2"]
    chef.roles_path = ["roles1", "roles2"]
  end
end
```

### Debug output

The debug output is [here](https://gist.github.com/dduponchel/60cf07fa0b6889e612e0c82a14c84afa).

The non-debug output (which shows the issue):
```
==> default: Running provisioner: chef_zero...
==> default: Detected Chef (12) is already installed
==> default: Generating chef JSON and uploading...
==> default: Warning: Chef run list is empty. This may not be what you want.
==> default: Running chef-client (local-mode)...
==> default: [2018-04-09T15:24:29+00:00] INFO: Started chef-zero at chefzero://localhost:8889 with repository at /tmp/vagrant-chef/14b596f79edc40048a7582708130684c, /tmp/vagrant-chef/fc2e1d920710e04a65ef7c7e1740037d
==> default:   One version per cookbook
==> default:   data_bags at /tmp/vagrant-chef/d26ab550e645a91e53ba113886cdafa9/data_bags
==> default:   roles at /tmp/vagrant-chef/0201b83616c9fa31a29e373747b23ec3/roles, /tmp/vagrant-chef/858841bd1b27f854b27830048bc6a3f9/roles
==> default:   nodes at /tmp/vagrant-chef/eb17407aad54206ad6c636c334efdcba/nodes, /tmp/vagrant-chef/b527128d49a1196bfc1379536bad1bc3/nodes
==> default: 
==> default: [2018-04-09T15:24:29+00:00] INFO: Forking chef instance to converge...
==> default: Starting Chef Client, version 12.22.1
```

### Expected behavior

When chef runs, it should show
```
==> default:   data_bags at /tmp/vagrant-chef/.../data_bags, /tmp/vagrant-chef/.../data_bags
```
Two paths, because two were given in the Vagrantfile.

### Actual behavior

When chef runs, it shows 
```
==> default:   data_bags at /tmp/vagrant-chef/.../data_bags
```
Only one path, while two were given.

### Steps to reproduce
1. run `mkdir cookbooks1 cookbooks2 data_bags1 data_bags2 nodes1 nodes2 roles1 roles2`
2. copy the Vagrantfile
3. run `vagrant up`

### References

- GH-5988
- GH-6561
